issue.description:
IBC SECTION 1012 RAMPS 1012_2 Slope (part of means of egress).
Ramp slope is 10.0%. The maximum slope for the ramps is 8.0%.
issue.title: Too Steep Ramp: 10.0%

suggestions.reasoning: The current ramp slope of 10.0% exceeds the maximum allowable slope of 8.0% as per IBC Section 1012.

suggestions.action: Implement a switchback design for the ramp.
suggestions.reasoning: A switchback design can effectively reduce the slope while maintaining accessibility, ensuring compliance with IBC standards.

suggestions.action: Add landings at intervals to break the slope.
suggestions.reasoning: Incorporating landings can help manage the slope and provide resting points, making the ramp compliant with the IBC requirements.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.0.3 tread length is 0.20 m. The minimum length for the tread is 0.28 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.3: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Extend tread depth to 0.28m by modifying stair geometry.
suggestions.reasoning: Current tread length is 0.20m, which is below the minimum requirement. Adjusting the stair geometry allows for compliance.

suggestions.action: Reposition non-load bearing wall to create recess for deeper treads.
suggestions.reasoning: Reconfiguring wall 2519147 allows for increased tread depth while maintaining stair width.

suggestions.action: Convert straight flight to L-shaped configuration using adjacent space as landing.
suggestions.reasoning: Utilizing space 2653326 as a landing allows for compliant treads through spatial reallocation.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Underside of stair should be shielded to protect visually impaired persons from accessing it inadvertently.
issue.title: Stair.0.3

suggestions.action: Install 1200mm high solid panels beneath the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: This solution uses adjacent walls for support, ensuring a protective barrier for visually impaired individuals.

suggestions.action: Apply truncated dome tactile flooring in corridors near the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: This tactile flooring will alert visually impaired individuals while maintaining compliance with safety standards.

suggestions.action: Create a sculptural bronze screen system mounted to adjacent walls.
suggestions.reasoning: This innovative design combines aesthetic appeal with functional shielding, enhancing safety for visually impaired users.
